newsitem.title: USA: Capstar Broadcasting to buy three radio stations.
newsitem.headline: Capstar Broadcasting to buy three radio stations.

text.p: Privately-held radio broadcasting company Capstar Broadcasting Co said its Capstar Acquisition Co Inc agreed to acquire three radio stations servicing the Huntsville, Ala. market for $5.45 million.
Capstar, which was formed last year by private investment firm of Hicks, Muse, Tate & Furst Inc of Dallas, said it was buying the stations from Griffith Broadcasting Inc.
The properties would be operated by Southern Star Communications Inc, another Capstar unit.
Upon completion of the deal, Capstar said it would have 229 middle-market radio stations throughout the United States.
It said it was buying WTAK-FM, WWXQ-FM and WQXW-FM.
